Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Livelihood \Live"li*hood\, n. [OE. livelode, liflode, prop., course of life, life's support, maintenance, fr. AS. l[=i]f life + l[=a]d road, way, maintenance. Confused with livelihood liveliness. See {Life}, and {Lode}.] Subsistence or living, as dependent on some means of support; the means for support of life; maintenance. [1913 Webster]
The opportunities of gaining an honest livelihood. --Addison. [1913 Webster]
It is their profession and livelihood to get their living by practices for which they deserve to forfeit their lives. --South. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Livelihood \Live"li*hood\, n. [Lively + -hood.] Liveliness; appearance of life. [Obs.] --Shak. [1913 Webster]

livelihood n : the financial means whereby one lives; "each child was expected to pay for their keep"; "he applied to the state for support"; "he could no longer earn his own livelihood" [syn: {support}, {keep}, {living}, {bread and butter}, {sustenance}]
